GREGG FINE

Full Stack Developer

Hello, I'm Gregg, a New Jersey/NYC-based Full Stack web developer specializing in JavaScript, React, Node, HTML5, and CSS3. I live in Westfield, NJ with my wife Erica, my daughter Eva, and my dogs Penny and Maya.

My passions are in developing applications focused on productivity, efficiency and music/audio related topics such as music theory, ear training, and audio engineering. I'm currently working on improving my Node skills as well as learning TypeScript and Python.

I hold a dual-degree from the New School for Social Research: a Bachelor of Fine Arts from The Mannes College of Music and a Bachelor of Arts from Eugene Lang College.

As a music producer and guitarist, I've traveled extensively and created music for many of the world's leading brands. I’m also a published educator with 17 courses on topics ranging from Music Theory, Jazz Improvisation, Ear Training, to Guitar Effects and Technology.

I also love making videos on various coding topics. Check out my Code Creative channel here...

1

Music Social Site

React Node Socket.io MongoDB Material-UI

I custom built this social sharing site for musicians to create user profiles and share their mixes for critique from their peers. The site is built with React for the view layer, Node/MongoDB for the backend, as well as Socket.io for real-time bidrectional communication.

View Site View Code

2

Searchable Music Library

JavaScript Node Express MongoDB Passport

My goal with this project was to create a searchable music library for my original music compositions. The full version consists of a custom CMS as well as Passport authentication. User has the ability to search via Genre, BPM, or Length and download the track once found.

View Site View Code

3

Guitar Website

HTML5 CSS3 JavaScript BEM Gulp

For this guitarist website, I leveraged BEM methodology, Gulp, and PostCSS along with modular, object-oriented JavaScript to create highly-organized and maintainable CSS.

View Site View Code

4

Rhythmic Ear Trainer

React Redux Semantic-UI

I utilized Redux to manage state for this ear training game I developed for music students. This project got me up to speed with React Hooks which I really enjoy for their readability as well as code reusability aspects. One challenging aspect was synchronizing the audio with the UI.

View Site View Code

5

Synth Explorer

Angular CSS3 JavaScript

Faced with a quick turnaround, I studied Angular's documentation to create this informational vintage synth site. The views are rendered dynamically from JSON data. I implemented a search field using some of Angular’s built-in directives to allow the user to find a particular synth. Each synth has a detail view when clicked on.

View Site View Code

6

Intervallic Ear Trainer

Web Audio API JavaScript jQuery SVG

I used the Web Audio API to create an intervallic ear training came for musicians. There are 4 sound sources to choose from as well as various possible starting pitches. “Easy” and “Hard” modes accommodate players of different skill levels.

View Site View Code
